items.content_html: Immediate fail for Safari at the day gig. No option for multiple profiles, which Chrome handles well. I keep forgetting this is why I am forced to use it and probably will again in the future.

items.content_html: Going to try Safari as my browser of choice for the rest of the week at work. I use it at home, but my day to day has pretty much forced Chrome just for the dev tools. Letâ€™s see if Safari can handle it .

items.content_html:
My youngest son turns 26 today.

Twenty-six…

When someone tells you they grow up before you know it, it’s not hyperbole. Cherish all the moments, both good and bad.

items.content_html: I re-enabled Twitter just so I could get an archive of my tweets to import into Micro.blog. Now it’s time to turn it back off. Thanks @manton for adding this feature.
items.content_text: I re-enabled Twitter *just* so I could get an archive of my tweets to import into Micro.blog. Now it's time to turn it back off. Thanks [@manton](https://micro.blog/manton) for adding this feature.

items.content_html: The time blocking experiment is proving to be fruitful. I was able to complete several tasks today without interruption.
items.content_text: The time blocking experiment is proving to be fruitful. I was able to complete several tasks today without interruption.
Joshua Tree

items.content_html: Going to try a time-blocking technique on my work calendar for a bit by adding four-hour “Get Shit Done” blocks Tuesday and Thursday afternoons. In those blocks, I’ll block smaller times for tasks that need total focus. Meeting requests during those times will be ignored. Let’s see how that works.
items.content_text: Going to try a time-blocking technique on my work calendar for a bit by adding four-hour "Get Shit Done" blocks Tuesday and Thursday afternoons. In those blocks, I'll block smaller times for tasks that need total focus. Meeting requests during those times will be ignored. Let's see how that works.

items.content_html:
Do you ever have those days when it seems everyone around you is frantic and acting like the sky is falling and you’re the only one who can save them?

Yep, it’s one of those days.
